column9: Notes
First reusable orbital spacecraft flight; first flight of Columbia
First reuse of a manned orbital space vehicle; first test of Canadarm robot arm; Truncated due to fuel cell problem.
Shuttle R&D flight, first and only landing at White Sands, New Mexico
Last shuttle R&D flight, first DoD payload
Multiple comsat deployments. First EVA of program canceled due to suit problems
TDRS deployment; first flight of Challenger; first space shuttle extra-vehicular activity
First US woman in space Sally Ride; Multiple comsat deployments; First deployment and retrieval of a satellite SPAS
Comsat deployment, first flight of an African American in space, Guion Bluford; test of robot arm on heavy payloads with Payload Flight Test Article, First night landing
First Spacelab mission, first ESA Astronaut
Comsat deployments, first untethered spacewalk by Bruce McCandless II withManned Maneuvering Unit; first landing at KSC; dry run of equipment for Solar Max rescue
Solar Max servicing (first satellite rescue by astronauts), LDEF deployment
Multiple comsat deployments; first flight of Discovery, test of OAST-1 Solar Array
Earth Radiation Budget Satellite deployment; First flight of two women in space Ride and Sullivan; First spacewalk by US woman, Kathryn Sullivan; First Canadian in space Marc Garneau
Multiple comsat deployments, retrieval of two other comsats Palapa B2 and WestarVI which were subsequently refurbished on Earth and reflown
First classified Department of Defense (DoD) mission; Magnum satellite deployment
Multiple comsat deployments, first flight of a sitting politician in space, Jake Garn, first impromptu EVA of program to fix Syncom F3 (Leasat 3)
Spacelab mission
Multiple comsat deployments. Flight of first member of royalty, Saudi, Muslim, andArab in space, Sultan bin Salman Al Saud.

Spacelab mission, Abort to Orbit. Faulty temperature sensor incorrectly indicated that fuel turbine discharge temperature exceeded the limit. Therefore, one main engine was shut down at T+345 s, resulting in a much lower orbit than planned. All mission objectives achieved.
Multiple comsat deployments, rescue of Syncom F3 (Leasat-3) by Astronauts
Second classified DoD mission; DSCS satellite deployment; first flight of Atlantis
Spacelab-D1, Germany funded mission, last successful mission of Challenger
Multiple comsat deployment, EASE/ACCESS experiment. First Mexican in space,Rodolfo Neri Vela
Comsat deployment, flight of US Representative Bill Nelson
Planned TDRS deployment, Loss of vehicle and crew, Teacher in Space Flight
TDRS deployment; first post Challenger flight
Third classified DoD mission; Lacrosse 1 deployment
TDRS-D/IUS, IMAX, SHARE I space station radiator experiment.
Magellan Venus probe deployment
Fourth classified DoD mission; Satellite Data System deployment
Galileo Jupiter probe deployment, IMAX
Fifth classified DoD mission; Magnum/IUS
SYNCOM IV-F5 satellite deployment, LDEF retrieval, IMAX
Sixth classified DoD mission; Misty reconnaissance satellite deployment
Hubble Space Telescope deployment
Ulysses/IUS solar probe deployment
Seventh classified DoD mission. Likely SDS2-2 deployed.
Use of ASTRO-1 observatory
Compton Gamma Ray Observatory deployment
First unclassified DoD mission; military science experiments
Spacelab mission
TDRS deployment
Upper Atmosphere Research Satellite deployment
DSP satellite deployment
Spacelab mission
ATLAS-1 science platform
Intelsat VI repair; first flight of Endeavour. First 3 person EVA. ASEM space station truss experiment EVA, record four EVAs total for mission.
Spacelab mission
EURECA (European Retrievable Carrier) and the joint NASA/Italian Space Agency Tethered Satellite System (TSS)
Spacelab-J, Japan funded mission
LAGEOS II, microgravity experiments
Partially classified 10th and final DoD mission. Likely deployment of SDS2 satellite.
TDRS-F/IUS deployment
ATLAS-2 science platform
Spacelab-D2, Germany funded mission
SPACEHAB, EURECA
ACTS satellite deployed, SPAS-Orfeus with IMAX camera.
Spacelab mission
Hubble Space Telescope servicing
SPACEHAB, Wake Shield Facility
Microgravity experiments
Shuttle Radar Laboratory-1
Spacelab mission
Multiple science experiments; SPARTAN
Space Radar Laboratory-2
ATLAS-3 science platform
Mir rendezvous, Spacehab, IMAX
ASTRO-2
First Shuttle-Mir docking
TDRS-G/IUS deployed
Wake Shield Facility, SPARTAN
Spacelab mission
2nd Shuttle-Mir docking. Delivered docking module. IMAX cargo bay camera.
Retrieved Japan's Space Flyer Unit, 2 EVAs.
Tethered satellite reflight, lost due to broken tether.
Shuttle-Mir docking
SPACEHAB; SPARTAN
Spacelab mission
Shuttle-Mir docking
Wake Shield Facility; ASTRO-SPAS
Shuttle-Mir docking
Hubble Space Telescope servicing
Truncated due to fuel cell problem
Shuttle-Mir docking
Spacelab mission
CRISTA-SPAS
Shuttle-Mir docking
Microgravity experiments, 2 EVAs, SPARTAN
Shuttle-Mir docking
Spacelab mission
Last Shuttle-Mir docking
SPACEHAB; John Glenn flies again
ISS assembly flight 2A: Node 1. First Shuttle ISS assembly flight
ISS supply
Chandra X-ray Observatory deployed
Hubble Space Telescope servicing
Shuttle Radar Topography Mission
ISS supply
ISS supply
ISS assembly flight 3A: Z1 truss
ISS assembly flight 4A: P6 solar arrays, radiators
ISS assembly flight 5A: Destiny lab
ISS supply, crew rotation
ISS assembly flight 6A: robotic arm; First spacewalk by a Canadian Chris Hadfield
ISS assembly flight 7A: Quest Joint Airlock
ISS supply, crew rotation
ISS supply, crew rotation
Hubble Space Telescope servicing, last successful mission for Columbia beforeSTS-107
ISS assembly flight 8A: S0 truss
ISS supply, crew rotation, Mobile Base System
ISS assembly flight 9A: S1 truss
ISS assembly flight 11A: P1 truss, crew rotation, last successful mission beforeSTS-107
SPACEHAB; Loss of vehicle and crew before landing at KSC
First post Columbia flight. Flight safety evaluation/testing, ISS supply/repair, MPLMRaffaello
ISS Flight ULF1.1: Supply, crew rotation, MPLM Leonardo
ISS assembly flight 12A: P3/P4 Truss, Solar Arrays
ISS assembly flight 12A.1: P5 Truss & Spacehab-SM, crew rotation
ISS assembly flight 13A: S3/S4 Truss, Solar Arrays, crew rotation
ISS assembly flight 13A.1: S5 Truss & Spacehab-SM & ESP3. First use of SSPTS(Station-to-Shuttle Power Transfer System)
ISS assembly flight 10A: US Harmony module, crew rotation
ISS assembly flight 1E: European Laboratory Columbus, crew rotation
ISS assembly flight 1J/A: JEM ELM PS & SPDM, crew rotation
ISS assembly flight 1J: JEM - Japanese module Kibo & JEM RMS
ISS assembly flight ULF2: MPLM Leonardo, crew rotation
ISS assembly flight 15A: S6 Truss, Solar Arrays
Last Hubble Space Telescope servicing mission (HST SM-04). Final Non-ISS flight.
ISS assembly flight 2J/A: JEM Exposed Facility (EF) & JEM ELM ES.
ISS assembly flight 17A: MPLM Leonardo & 6 person ISS crew.
ISS assembly flight ULF3: ExPRESS Logistics Carriers (ELCs) 1 & 2.
ISS assembly flight 20A: Node 3 and Cupola
ISS assembly flight 19A: Utility and Logistics Flight 4: Multi-Purpose Logistics Module Leonardo. Last night launch of the Shuttle Program
ISS assembly flight ULF4: Mini-Research Module 1.
ISS assembly flight ULF5, PMM Leonardo (to be left permanently attached), ELC 4. Final flight of Discovery.
ISS assembly flight ULF6, ELC 3, ROEU, Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer. Final flight of Endeavour.
Payload Multi-Purpose Logistics Module (MPLM) Raffaello. Final flight of Atlantis, final flight of the Space Shuttle program.
